instruction: Can the combination of hyperspectral imaging (HSI) and convolutional neural networks (CNN) be considered a superior method for identifying soil microplastic polymers (MPPs) compared to traditional chemical methods, considering the quick and non-destructive results it offers?
Output: Yes, the combination of hyperspectral imaging (HSI) and convolutional neural networks (CNN) can be considered a superior method for identifying soil microplastic polymers (MPPs) compared to traditional chemical methods. The research demonstrated that the CNN model achieved a classification accuracy of 92.6% for MPPs on the soil surface, which was higher than the accuracy achieved by decision tree (87.9%) and support vector machine (85.6%) models. When combined with HSI, the CNN model produced the best classification results among all the models tested. Additionally, the suggested technique of using HSI and CNN offered quick and non-destructive results for MPPs detection, which is advantageous compared to the time-consuming and cumbersome traditional chemical methods.
